Welcome to Enigma’s documentation!¶

Encrypts and/or decrypts messages.

enigma_kostas.enigma_run.enigma_encrypt(message, rotor_order_str)¶

Takes as inputs a message to encrypt/decrypt and the order of the 3 out of 5 pre built rotors. The connections of the plugboard are already given and can be changed by modifying the “plug” dictionary.

Parameters
message

The message to encrypt or decrypt.

rotor_order_str

A string of three numbers from 1-5, e.g. “243”.

Returns
char

The message encrypted or decrypted.

Classes for Rotors and Reflectors of the enigma machines.

class enigma_kostas.rotors.Reflector(seed)¶

The reflector is a part of the enigma machine that reflects the output of the 3 rotors, back to them for further encryption. Letters are connected in pairs.

Methods

make_the_wiring()

Sets the dictionary for the reflector.

print_rotor_info()

Print position of the notch and the dictionary of letters for a rotor.

reflector_change_the_letter(message)

Takes an input message, makes all letters uppercase and removes whitespace.

rotor_rotate_after_encrypt()

Changes the dictionary of the letters to encrypt.

rottor_decrypt_the_letter(message)

Return the message decrypted.

rottor_encrypt_the_letter(message)

Takes an input message, makes all letters uppercase and removes whitespace.
make_the_wiring()¶

Sets the dictionary for the reflector. Letters are connected in pairs.

reflector_change_the_letter(message)¶

Takes an input message, makes all letters uppercase and removes whitespace. Returns the message encrypted.

class enigma_kostas.rotors.Rotor(seed)¶

Rotors have an internal circuit that connects the 26 input latin letters with the 26 output letters. The circuit is simulated with a dictionary, the values of which are randomly sampled without replacement out of the 26 letters. The rotors also have a notch, which allows rotors 2 and 3 to be rotated and thus change the internal circuit that connects input and output letters.

Methods

make_the_wiring()

Sets the dictionary for the rotor.

print_rotor_info()

Print position of the notch and the dictionary of letters for a rotor.

rotor_rotate_after_encrypt()

Changes the dictionary of the letters to encrypt.

rottor_decrypt_the_letter(message)

Return the message decrypted.

rottor_encrypt_the_letter(message)

Takes an input message, makes all letters uppercase and removes whitespace.
make_the_wiring()¶

Sets the dictionary for the rotor.

print_rotor_info()¶

Print position of the notch and the dictionary of letters for a rotor.

rotor_rotate_after_encrypt()¶

Changes the dictionary of the letters to encrypt.

rottor_decrypt_the_letter(message)¶

Return the message decrypted.

rottor_encrypt_the_letter(message)¶

Takes an input message, makes all letters uppercase and removes whitespace. Return the message encrypted.

class enigma_kostas.plugboard.Plugboard(dict_of_connections)¶

Plugboard is a part of the enigma machine which can cause a letter to be changed 0, 1 or 2 times.

Methods

plugboard_encrypt_the_letters(message)

Takes as input a dictionary of letters to connect and swaps the connected letters with each other.
plugboard_encrypt_the_letters(message)¶

Takes as input a dictionary of letters to connect and swaps the connected letters with each other. Letters without connections do not change. E.g. A connection between “w” and “h” is made, so if the message “HELLOWORLD” passes though the plugboard, it will come out as “WELLOHORLD”.
